So you're there working as an instructor and the next thing happens is VJ Day.
And now the war is over.
What was the state, what was the mindset of America on VJ Day?
Just, I don't know how to explain it, but extreme joy.
And I don't think there's any more from a service man that served in that time about the use of the atomic bomb.
And I really had Truman and he did a good job.
And especially when you hear the stories from the guys that fought in the Pacific on the ground against the Japanese,
I mean, it was going to be absolutely horrendous if we had to go into mainland Japan.
And you know, we know they were training their kids and the women to fight with sticks and hiding caves.
And we would have just wiped them out.
We would kill more Japanese than Americans.
